item.title: 人工智能引发中国智能手机市场反弹，高通公司股价大涨
item.description: 高通公司（Qualcomm）股价周四在盘前交易中上涨 4%，这家专注于智能手机的芯片制造商在经历了两年的低迷之后，发出了人工智能推动需求反弹的信号，尤其是在中国。【原文：Qualcomm shares rose 4% in premarket trading on Thursday after the smartphone-focused chipmaker signaled an AI-fueled rebound in demand, especially in China, after a two-year slump.】

item.title: 尼日利亚法院将 Binance 及高管的审判延期至 5 月 17 日
item.description: 尼日利亚一家法院周四将针对加密货币交易所 Binance 及其两名高管的洗钱审判延期至 5 月 17 日，因为该交易所的一名律师称，他尚未收到准备案件所需的文件。【原文：A Nigerian court on Thursday adjourned a money laundering trial against cryptocurrency exchange Binance and two of its executives to May 17 after a lawyer for the exchange said he had not been served with documents needed to prepare for the case.】

item.title: Peloton 首席执行官卸任
item.description: 联网健身公司 Peloton Interactive 周四表示，巴里-麦卡锡（Barry McCarthy）已辞去首席执行官一职。【原文：Connected-fitness company Peloton Interactive said on Thursday Barry McCarthy has stepped down as CEO.】

item.title: 康菲石油公司季度利润不及预期
item.description: 由于需求担忧导致天然气价格大幅下跌，美国石油和天然气生产商康菲石油公司（ConocoPhillips）周四公布的第一季度利润不及华尔街预期。【原文：U.S. oil and gas producer ConocoPhillips missed Wall Street estimates for first-quarter profit on Thursday, as demand concerns led to a sharp fall in natural gas prices.】

item.title: 风电场开发商 Orsted 第一季度利润增长，对战略充满信心
item.description: 全球最大的海上风电场开发商 Orsted 周四报告称，由于海上风电场盈利增加，第一季度营业利润有所增长，并确认了全年业绩指导。【原文：Orsted , the world's biggest offshore wind farm developer, reported on Thursday a rise in first-quarter operating profit thanks to higher earnings from its offshore wind farms, and confirmed its full-year guidance.】

item.title: 消息人士称欧佩克+可能延长石油减产，但正式会谈尚未开始
item.description: 欧佩克（OPEC）及其盟国尚未开始就将每天 220 万桶的自愿石油减产计划延长至 6 月以后展开正式谈判，但来自欧佩克+产油国的三位减产消息人士称，如果需求未能回升，他们可能会延长减产计划。【原文：OPEC and its allies have yet to begin formal talks on extending 2.2 million barrels per day of voluntary oil output cuts beyond June, but three sources from OPEC+ producers who have reduced production said they could extend if demand fails to pick up.】

item.title: Eylea和Dupixent销售疲软，Regeneron利润不及预期
item.description: 美国制药商Regeneron Pharmaceuticals Inc周四公布的第一季度利润不及华尔街预期，原因是其大片眼药Eylea和湿疹治疗药物Dupixent的销售疲软。【原文：U.S. drugmaker Regeneron Pharmaceuticals Inc missed Wall Street estimates for first-quarter profit on Thursday due to softer sales of its blockbuster eye drug Eylea and its eczema treatment, Dupixent.】

item.title: 汤森路透上调年度财务预期
item.description: 汤森路透周四公布的营收超出预期，并上调了年度财务预期，原因是该公司继续在人工智能领域投入巨资。【原文：Thomson Reuters beat revenue expectations and raised its annual financial forecast on Thursday as it continued to invest heavily in artificial intelligence.】

item.title: Moderna 季度销售额超出预期，但同比大幅下滑
item.description: Moderna 公司周四公布的季度收入超过了华尔街的预期，但却大大低于前一年 COVID-19 疫苗需求较高的时候。【原文：Moderna on Thursday reported quarterly revenue that beat Wall Street estimates but came in dramatically lower than the previous year when demand for COVID-19 vaccines was higher.】

item.title: 劳合社保险公司预计巴尔的摩桥梁索赔率将保持在中等水平
item.description: 伦敦劳合社（SOLYD.UL）保险公司 Hiscox 和 Lancashire 周四表示，预计巴尔的摩弗朗西斯-斯科特-基大桥 3 月份的垮塌不会造成大范围的保险理赔。【原文：Lloyd's of London (SOLYD.UL) insurers Hiscox and Lancashire do not expect large insurance claims from the collapse of Baltimore's Francis Scott Key Bridge in March that caused widespread disruption, they said on Thursday.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，保险公司 Chubb 准备在巴尔的摩桥梁垮塌事故中赔偿 3.5 亿美元
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周四报道，巴尔的摩弗朗西斯-斯科特-基大桥于今年 3 月垮塌，该大桥的保险公司 Chubb 正准备向马里兰州政府支付 3.5 亿美元的赔偿金。【原文：Chubb , the insurer of Baltimore's Francis Scott Key Bridge that collapsed in March, is preparing to make a $350 million payout to the state of Maryland, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 美联储加息忧虑消除，期货攀升
item.description: 在美联储维持利率不变并消除了市场对潜在加息的担忧之后一天，美国股指期货周四走高，市场关注的焦点转向当天的一系列最新财报。【原文：U.S. stock index futures advanced on Thursday, a day after the Federal Reserve left interest rates unchanged and allayed fears around potential rate hikes, with focus moving to a spate of earnings updates through the day.】

item.title: 科技巨头市值因人工智能疑虑和高利率下跌；Alphabet 和特斯拉上涨
item.description: 受人工智能热情下降和央行降息预期减弱的影响，顶级科技巨头的市值在 4 月份大幅下跌。【原文：The market capitalisation of top technology giants fell sharply in April, pressured by diminishing enthusiasm for artificial intelligence and a scaling back of expectations for central bank interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 加航因商务旅行反弹而减少调整后亏损
item.description: 加拿大航空公司（Air Canada）周四公布的第一季度调整后亏损减少，原因是加拿大最大的航空公司受益于商务旅行预订量的回升。【原文：Air Canada reported a smaller first-quarter adjusted loss on Thursday, as Canada's largest carrier benefited from a rebound in bookings for business travel.】

item.title: 工会和企业关注移民，以填补俄亥俄州的劳动力缺口
item.description: 在俄亥俄州哥伦布市一家嘈杂的工厂车间里，工会学徒豪尔赫-埃雷拉（Jorge Herrera）在组装通风管道，他的动作很快，这些通风管道将用于市郊一家大型汽车制造厂的建设。【原文：On a noisy factory floor in Columbus, Ohio, trade union apprentice Jorge Herrera moved quickly as he assembled ventilation ducts to be used in the construction of a large car manufacturing plant on the outskirts of the city.】

item.title: 早间竞价：美联储缩减量化宽松政策平息马群，日元再度走强
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 谷歌在美国市场支配力审判中面临终结辩论
item.description: 美国政府将在周四的结案陈词中阐述对 Alphabet 旗下谷歌公司的反垄断诉讼，从而结束这场在线搜索领军企业被控违法以保持领先地位的审判。【原文：The U.S. government will layout its antitrust case against Alphabet's Google in closing arguments on Thursday, wrapping up a trial in which the online search leader is accused of breaking the law to stay on top.】

item.title: Cigna 因成本下降和药房福利优势而实现强劲的年度利润
item.description: 健康保险公司信诺集团周四上调了年度盈利预期，原因是医疗成本低于预期以及药房福利管理部门的强劲表现帮助其第一季度盈利超过预期。【原文：Health insurer Cigna Group raised its annual profit forecast on Thursday, as lower-than-expected medical costs and strength in its pharmacy benefit management unit helped it beat first-quarter earnings estimates.】

item.title: 前日本央行官员预测日本将继续干预以防止日元自由落体式下跌
item.description: 一位曾在十年前参与东京市场干预的前央行官员表示，在投机者引发日元自由下跌的风险消除之前，日本可能会继续干预以支撑日元。【原文：Japan will likely keep intervening to prop up the yen until the risk of speculators triggering a free fall in the currency has been eliminated, said a former central bank official who was involved in Tokyo's market forays a decade ago.】

item.title: 采购经理人指数显示，欧元区 4 月份工厂活动转差
item.description: 周四的一项调查显示，欧元区制造业活动的持续低迷在4月份有所加深，原因是尽管工厂纷纷降价，但需求仍在萎缩，促使企业再次裁员。【原文：The ongoing downturn in euro zone manufacturing activity deepened in April due to crumbling demand despite factories cutting prices, pushing firms to reduce headcount again, a survey showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 法国航空公司、布鲁塞尔航空公司等航空公司被欧盟列入 "绿色清洗 "调查名单
item.description: 法国航空公司（Air France）和布鲁塞尔航空公司（Brussels Airlines）向路透社证实了比利时广播公司 RTBF 的报道，这两家航空公司是欧盟正在调查的 20 家航空公司之一，因为它们可能存在误导性的 "绿化 "行为。【原文：Air France and Brussels Airlines are among 20 airlines being investigated by the European Union for potentially misleading greenwashing practices, the airlines told Reuters, confirming a report by Belgian broadcaster RTBF.】

item.title: 欧股开盘在盈利潮和美联储结果的影响下下滑
item.description: 周四，欧洲股市开盘后走势低迷，因为投资者在周中假期结束后重返市场，分析一系列大单财报，以及美联储推迟降息的信号。【原文：European shares opened on a sombre note on Thursday as investors returned after a mid-week holiday to parse a slew of big-ticket earnings and the Federal Reserve signalling a delay in interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 环球音乐集团与 TikTok 达成新的授权协议
item.description: 环球音乐集团（Universal Music Group）和 TikTok 周四表示，双方已达成一项新的授权协议，该协议将使环球音乐集团的歌曲和艺人重新登陆社交媒体平台。【原文：Universal Music Group and TikTok said on Thursday that they had reached a new licensing agreement that will restore the label's songs and artists to the social media platform.】

item.title: 解说员：日本最近疑似干预日元的策略是什么？
item.description: 日元兑美元汇率飙升，交易商认为这是日本当局为阻止日元大幅下跌而采取的又一轮干预措施。【原文：The yen surged against the dollar on what traders suspect was another round of intervention by Japanese authorities to stem the currency's sharp declines.】

item.title: 美国经济表现出色，经合组织上调全球经济增长展望
item.description: 经合组织（OECD）周四表示，得益于美国经济活动的恢复性增长，全球经济增长速度超过了几个月前的预期，而通胀正以比预期更快的速度向各国央行的目标靠拢，该组织上调了对全球经济的展望。【原文：The global economy is growing faster than expected only a few months ago thanks to resilient U.S. activity while inflation is converging more quickly than expected with central banks' targets, the OECD said on Thursday, upgrading its outlook.】

item.title: 俄罗斯法院取消扣押摩根大通银行与俄罗斯 VTB 纠纷中的部分资金
item.description: 根据一份法庭文件，在与俄罗斯国有银行 VTB 的纠纷中，俄罗斯法院取消了扣押摩根大通在俄罗斯的部分资金的决定。【原文：A Russian court cancelled the seizure of part of JPMorgan Chase's funds in Russia in a dispute with Russian state-owned bank VTB , according to a court document.】

item.title: 日本 3 月家庭支出可能加速下滑
item.description: 路透社周四的一项民意调查显示，日本家庭支出可能在3月份加快了下降步伐，这凸显了渴望实现自我维持经济增长和货币政策正常化的决策者所面临的困难。【原文：Japanese household spending probably accelerated its pace of declines in March, a Reuters poll showed on Thursday, underscoring the difficulties facing policymakers keen to engineer self-sustaining economic growth and normalise monetary policy.】

item.title: 马士基第一季度利润超预期，上调财政年度指导区间下限
item.description: 航运集团马士基周四公布的第一季度盈利高于预期，并上调了全年利润指导区间的下限，这主要得益于需求增长和将船只调离红海。【原文：Shipping group Maersk on Thursday reported first-quarter earnings above expectations and lifted the lower end of its full-year profit guidance range, supported by higher demand and the diverting of vessels away from the Red Sea.】

item.title: 壳牌第一季度盈利 77 亿美元，超出预期
item.description: 壳牌周四公布的第一季度调整后收益为 77 亿美元，大幅超出预期，原因是石油交易强劲，炼油利润率提高。【原文：Shell on Thursday reported first-quarter adjusted earnings of $7.7 billion, sharply beating expectations, on the back of strong oil trading and higher refining margins.】

item.title: 日本住友商事净利润下降 32%，低于预期
item.description: 日本贸易公司住友商事（Sumitomo Corp）报告称，截至 3 月份的财年净利润为 3,864 亿日元（合 25 亿美元），同比下降 31.7%，低于预期。【原文：Japanese trading house Sumitomo Corp reported net profit for the fiscal year ended in March fell 31.7% from a year earlier to 386.4 billion yen ($2.5 billion), missing estimates.】
